subclassFeature.name: Circle of Scales
entries: Druids of the Circle of Scales believe that no creature embodies the wrath of nature quite like the mighty dragon. The awe-inspiring power of dragons has shaped the world since the dawn of time, and druids of this circle do not shy away from that power. Instead, they embrace it, studying the rich history of these beings and eventually learning how to capture their magical essence in the form of their own draconic transformation.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Spells
entries: {@i 2nd-level Circle of Scales Feature}

You have a special connection to the might and magic of dragons, granting you access to certain spells. You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Circle of Scales Spells table. Each spell counts as a druid spell for you. You always have these spells prepared, and they don't count against the number of druid spells you can prepare each day.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Aspect
entries: {@i 2nd-level Circle of Scales Feature}

As a bonus action, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape feature to transform into an draconic beast—a quadrupedal, reptilian creature suffused with the essence of true dragons. This Wild Shape option uses the {@creature Dragon Aspect|CircleofScales} stat block, and uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. This form lasts for 10 minutes, or until you use the ability again. You otherwise obey all of the normal rules for Wild Shape.

subclassFeature.name: Mythical Strikes
entries: {@i 6th-level Circle of Scales Feature}

Your attacks become infused with the innate magic of dragons. While in your Dragon Aspect form, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. Additionally, attacks you make in your Dragon Aspect form count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Dragon Aspect
entries: {@i 10th-level Circle of Scales Feature}
The connection you have to true dragons has deepened, and your form more accurately reflects their magnificent abilities. While in Dragon Aspect form, you gain the following additional features:

entries.name: Draconic Perception
entries: You gain {@sense blindsight} out to a range of 10 feet.

entries.name: Fearful Presence
entries: As an action, you can unleash a mighty roar, forcing all creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, they become {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you transform into your Dragon Aspect again.

entries.name: Flight of the Dragon
entries: You now sprout dragon wings when you transform, gaining a flying speed of 60 feet.

entries.name: Massive Form
entries: Your size increases to Huge, and your Dragon Breath feature becomes a 30 foot cone.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Being
entries: {@i 14th-level Circle of Scales Feature}
The blood of dragons flows through you, and your awesome display of power is the stuff of myths and legends. You gain the following abilities, both in and out of your Dragon Aspect form:

entries.name: Draconic Resilence
entries: You can reroll any saving throw that you fail, and you must use the new roll. Once a reroll succeeds, you cannot use this feature again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Draconic Reflexes
entries: At the end of another creature's turn, you may use your reaction to do one of the following:

items: Move up to half your speed.

resist.special: determined by your Draconic Affinity trait

trait.name: Draconic Affinity
entries: When you transform into your Dragon Aspect, choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. The chosen type determines your damage resistance while in this form, as well as the damage of your *Dragon Breath* action and your 10th level *Shred* attack.

trait.name: Mental Scores
entries: {@homebrew The Intelligence, Wisdom and Charismo ability scores of the Dragon Aspect are the same as your own Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma ability scores.}

action.name: Shred
entries: {@atk mw} your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + PB} slashing damage. Beginning at 10th level, you also add an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of the same type as your Draconic Affinity trait.

action.name: Dragon Breath
entries: You can expend a 1st level spell slot to exhale an elemental breath attack in a 15 foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 4d6} damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. The damage type is determined by your Draconic Affinity trait.
You can increase the damage of this breath attack by expending a higher level spell slot. If you do, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.
